data.text:
Season 1 Season 2 Season 3 List of Episodes

The third and final season of The Owl House was greenlit on May 17, 2021, ahead of the second season premiere.[5] It premiered on October 15, 2022,[1][2][3] and ended on April 8, 2023.

This season served as the final season,[6] and consists of three episodes; two 44-minute specials, and a final 55-minute special.[5][7][8]

Plot[]

Main article: Timeline

The 44-minute specials follow Luz's journey to save the Boiling Isles from the evil Emperor Belos & the unpredictable Collector.[3]

Season Overview[]

Season Episodes Production codes Start date End date Average viewers 3 3 301 – 303 (Disney and airing)

450H-301 – 450H-303 (production) October 15, 2022 April 8, 2023 0.40

Episodes[]

Main article: List of The Owl House episodes

Episode # Production codes Title Synopsis Airdate Viewers (millions) Disney[9] Prod. 1 301 450H-301.1[10]

450H-301.2[11] "Thanks to Them" Luz and her friends make a daring attempt to return to the Demon Realm.[12] October 15, 2022[1][2][3] 0.26[13] 2 302 450H-302.01[14]

450H-302.2[15] "For the Future" Luz and her friends race against Belos to confront the Collector and save the Boiling Isles.[16] January 21, 2023[17] 0.44[18] 3 303 450H-303.1[19]

450H-303.2[20] "Watching and Dreaming" The fate of everything on the Boiling Isles now rests on the shoulders of a human, a cursed witch, and a determined but tiny little King.[21] April 8, 2023 0.50[22]

Trivia[]

The first words in each episode spell out "Thanks For Watching", which references that this is the last season of the show.

When placed in reverse order, the episode titles form "Watching and dreaming for the future, thanks to them", referring to Luz regaining her optimistic spirit at the end of the series.

This is the only season not to feature coded runes in the background. However, in one of the animatics of the final episode, a rune message that spelled "The End" would have appeared after the end of the episode. This ultimately did not make it to the final version.[23]

Each episode premiered in the middle month of a season with the time span between them being 3 months long.

The entire season was uploaded as a 2 ½-hour long video to the Disney Channel YouTube channel on April 13, 2023.

Production information[]

On March 10, 2023, Dana Terrace confirmed on Twitter that the production of the season and the series overall had ended, with the final episode being finished and delivered to the network.

Sarah-Nicole Robles made her last voice recording for Luz on January 20, 2023.[24]

Every episode from this season was animated by Sugarcube.
